page.title: 13Mills-Blythe,Maxstoke
page.content: Maxstoke Mill,at Dukes End was built in the 1780's.The original mill is on the River Blythe,since then no changes have been made.It is about the same age as Blythe Mill but it is more derelict.Maxstoke Mill stopped working in 1949 because farmers began to use more modern machinery to grind their corn.Mr Jones doesn't own Maxstoke Mill but he is the manager of it.The owner of Maxstoke Mill is Captain Fetherston-Dilke.This family have owned the land and mill since the 14thC the last people to live in the mill was the Antrobus family.Mr Jones told us that it would take about 30-40 thousand pounds to restore the mill.Mr Jones also farms the land around the mill.He owns 110 cows and farms 280 acres of{arable}and{pasture}land.
